Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Four line inscription. Piece of rim projecting to left. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 158; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 299. Casanova, P. 1893. Catalogue des pièces de verre des époques byzantine et arabe de la collection Fouquet. ‘Mémoires publicées par les membres de la Mission Archéologique Francaise au Caire’ VI. Paris, 1415. Cf. Launois 1957, 159-60; Balog 1976, 300.

The 'lām' of 'aṣlaḥahu' is not clear on any specimen. It may have been missed out, as occurs on a number of Ṣāliḥ b. ʿAlī's other pieces. If the reading given is complete this type is unique in having Ṣāliḥ b. ʿAlī's name without the title 'al-amīr' but it is possible that 'al-amīr' was on the die at the end of the first line or perhaps at the beginning of the second. Casanova implies that the legend of Fouquet's specimen included the title.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (169)
